column5: Good evening  I managed to get out fishing recently and I was lucky enough to find some nice perch to kick off open water season  It took us about 2 hours of searching before we caught a fish and located a school... the next 4 hours after that would turn out to be the best 4 hours of perch fishing I can ever remember experiencing  The average size we were catching was phenomenal and literally 4/5 fish were keepers... I'd say about half our catch was 11-12" range and the pig of the day was a whopping 14" fish  We finished up with 80 in the box between the 2 of us and both our families were pleased with a fresh feed for everyone  We were targeting shallow flats from 4-8 feet of water with slip floats and small plastics (that's right... NO BAIT lol)... the key was finding how shallow they had moved up the bank and then next was locating old weed growth  We were giggling like little kids we had so much fun  Thanks  Mike
Nice haul Mike. I like to fish them  between seasons. Also adds to a nice feed of fresh fish.
~~~Dang with I had been able to get out, Phishen from Shore, may be fun, but ratter be out in my Boat, next weekend
Nice! I can honestly say that I love perch fishing! Always so much fun! And great eats! Nice work!  S.
Been on Simcoe couple times. It's been good with the best to come yet.
Jesus! Great haul and quality perch.  Also, is that Bass pro hat from 1984?
Thanks everyone  Gunna try again this weekend for a repeat before the bite ends
Nice bag!  I'll be out with my son on Friday if the winds let me get to where I want.  Trouble with Great Lakes perch is the wind never wants to cooperate when I have time off!

~~~Went up to Orillia for the Perch Derby, caught some to enter, phishen from shore, later went down to the Talbot Canal exit, big crowd on the lake side of the Swing bridge, lots of tangled lines and swearing, across the road on the other side of the bridge no one but me and 3 others, picked up 2 very nice perch. and a whole lot of pinheads swimming up stream
Wow, that's gonna be a feast
